messages.text:
Awesome! Glad to have you. Could use some help with the project management and keeping everything moving along smoothly.

Post your Trello account in <#C9498BH8C|access-requests> and then let’s discuss management ideas in <#C93ARTCGG|community-management>

Hi, I am a Management Consultant with MBA. I don't have experience in programming, but I am confident that I can add value Business Strategy, Market Research, Finance, Marketing, Operations, Project Management and any other semi-useful fluffy stuff. 
I have been in cryptos since Jun 2017. I understand it enough to know its impact on the future. I have couple of Blockchain ideas, but would love to work with talented people with programming skills while providing my expertise on business side of things. 

Feel free to reach out to me if you need help with business strategy, digital marketing or anything related to the business side.

Hi everyone, 
I am an UX Designer working is south of France, I also learned to code (Angular 1) and now I like to code in React + Viewmodel (a nice and simple wrapper: <http://viewmodel.org>) with the help of Meteor for a backend. 
Been in cryptos since 2016 with ETH,
I currently have a project in early phase that I would love to develop with talented people, please come and talk with me about this if you know React, Meteor, Blockchain, Design, Business, Marketing...
So what MLG game are you a champ of? :grin:

Yup reading your profile made me think I have a chance in this group even with all the other intimidating profiles!  I really love the decentralized nature of blockchain and want to support it and build on it.

Hi everyone! Quick summary about me:
- being involved in web development for the past 8 years: Ruby on Rails, node.js, react, ember, …
- taught introduction to web development for 4 years to a local university, and was also part in the creation of a student startup pre-incubator, helping students shape their business ideas into projects in order to be accepted to bigger incubators / receive funding
- started myself a couple of projects
- been in crypto since the beginning of last year, learned solidity and started playing with contracts since then 
-> now I’m fascinated about the possibilities the blockchain technologies can bring to the world so I’m hoping here we could create prosper together a community of great projects.

Hey guys. I’m a full stack web developer for work. I have developed APIs in Python and Node and have experience building web apps with Angular and React/Redux. I am very interested in the future of blockchain technologies so I began teaching myself Solidity and figuring out the whole Ethereum ecosystem. Psyched to see whatever this group turns into

Hey gang. Background in building products, been coding since I was 15 (HTML/CSS) — the good old days of Geocities and `<marquee>` tags if anyone remembers them! More recently it’s been with Golang, Swift (iOS), React JS, Mobx, Web3, Solidity and the AWS stack (EC2, RDS, ElastiCache - Redis, Kinesis). Also do a bit of UI design (Sketch) - which can often lead to some strange context switches, 1 minute you’re in the depths of *nix debugging a deployment issue and then you’re laying out squares on a canvas… but I enjoy all aspects of building products and happy to fit in wherever I can lend a hand.

Hi everyone! I'm a data scientist working in SF. I also teach at University as a lecturer for full-stack web development. Have some experience with react.js. Just recently picked up Solidity and try to get better with it on a daily basis now.
I am from China. Can totally help in digital marketing on Chinese or asian social media.
Hi folks. I just joined. I am a data scientist with some ML / AI specialty. I did some PHP and Ruby-on-Rails long time ago. Would love to participate.

Hi guys,  I have experience making apps using ruby/rails, JS, and react/ redux.  I love the potential of blockchain technology!  I am currently taking online lessons to learn Truffle, Solidity and Web3.  I can’t wait to help out with this project.

Hi everyone! Lots of talent in here. I’m an interaction designer (UI/UX) and work at The University of Toronto full time. I also teach interaction design and development at Sheridan College. I spend most of my time on design and prototyping and everything that comes with it but also do a lot of front end dev work (js, css, HTML), php and similar. I’m focusing on react lately. 

I first heard of Ethereum when I went to a meetup in Toronto in 2014 where Vitalik and a few others talked about this new project they were launching called Ethereum. It was the right place, right time to get into crypto and have been into holding Eth since the presale. Doge however was my first crypto : ) 

I’m looking to get into on the design and ux side of things on dapps. I also have a background of shooting photos and video professionally for design and marketing agencies but now focus on all things web and blockchain.

Oh hai there! Super quick facts about me:
- Msc. In Innovation and Entrepreneurship
- Started Amiroh (<http://www.amiroh.com|www.amiroh.com>) right out of college
- Now doing cross-platform app development and backend on MEAN, management and marketing. 
- Got into crypto around December. Fell in love with etheruem and blockchain technology. Currently learning Solidity in my free time.

I don't have too much free time these days, but I can tell all of it will be going to this and my Solidity courses!

Hi Folks! 
I got my Bachelor’s in Graphic Design from New Zealand. Moved to the US, designed professionally for a few years after which I got into front end development (yep those jQuery days), quickly grew into the frontend more and got into more frameworks Angular, Backbone etc. Worked at companies such as Adobe as well as more corporate banks and then startups. Now I’m the front end engineering manager and do a lot of React, Redux at my current role in a fast growing startup (if I can call it that at this point) and run a team of 7 front end engineers. I’m very interested in block chain tech and looking to get my hands dirty into some development. Interested specifically in Ether and Stellar networks for now. Would love to get some cool app going.

Hey folks, former scientist who went fulltime solidity recently.  I have been interested in dapp collaboration for awhile.  I've coded some governance and voting contracts privately.  I also have managed a Meteor website, so know some js.  Excited about this project!
absolutely, as well as any interesting project we got here

Hello! I'm currently a Java developer working in a networking, message brokering type of system with multiple entry points and simultaneous communication. Prior to this I've worked with some low level embedded networking (C), and prior to that I worked with some full stack web development (C#, javascript, html, css). Actually using javascript/jquery a bit in my current project as well. I've been invested in crypto for about 3 years now, primarily on the investing/trading end of it, but as of last year I started to get more informed on the technicalities of blockchain technologies. I've been meaning to get more involved so here I am!

Hi everyone! I don't have any professional experience in programming but I've been playing with different languages for a few years now. Mainly python and JS, but also PHP, (Android) Java and a bit of C++. I'm fluent in German, Spanish and English so I might be able to help with translations and stuff. I'm also very interested in learning and participating in dapp development in general.
Hey guys, I’m an InfoSec student, programmer and web dev. I’ve also been trading cryptos since 2015. I’ve just started to look at smart contract programming & security analysis. Happy to help out.

Hey all. I am from Belgium and I've been a . NET Developer since 2003 and started my career all the way back at version 1.1 of the DotNet framework. How time flies... Been involved with <http://ASP.NET|ASP.NET> dev ever since. Also worked extensively with CMS systems like Sitecore and Umbraco. I've worked for big and small companies and picked up enterprise experience on the way. Lately I've been almost obsessed with crypto currencies and blockchain technology and I'm very eager to learn more. I hope I can help out this community. Let's build some cool stuff!
Glad to have you, Gustav! :thumbsup:
Great skill set. We are definitely going to need designers / brand specilists. :thumbsup:

Wow, impressive! Very happy to have you aboard and your experience/insight into the scaling progress.

Would you be willing to help in the discussion for group Solidity contracts over at <#C9403E24A|group-contracts>?

Haha yes they are definitely sinking. I'm comfortable with my positions but if they sink to a certain point I will have to scoop up more :thumbsup: 

Glad to have you aboard!
Awesome. You have a strong background :thumbsup:
Glad you joined us, Justin! Do you want to help out with the Trello organization? If so, send me your Trello username and I will add you to the team over there.
Awesome. I'm sure you'll end up finding some willing teammates here :slightly_smiling_face:
Similar to my background with PHP and JavaScript. Welcome!

I'm sure that experience will come in handy. There's so much to cloud infrastructure, it's hard to master it all in your spare time.

I'm moderately proficient with a handful of AWS tools, but no where near all of them.

Have also dabbled in some of Azure's cloud services, which are pretty awesome too (e.g. used their Translation API for a Python app I wrote).

Glad to have you in the group!
Nice skill set! You're in the right place :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi all. I posted in the Reddit thread as bob_newhart. I was a business analyst in a past life. I was the first business analyst in our company so we were learning as we went and didn't have much structure. I might be able to help with writing stories and basic project management stuff. I have aspirations and dreams to be a dev but can help immediately with other stuff. I have experience using Jira and trello. We used Jira professionally and I have used Trello in my personal life. Looking forward to being part of something like this!

So quick introduction, I'm currently a Java developer working with GWT. Previous to this I worked with Javascript for about 1 year and a few months, which also included some pieces of work with HTML & CSS. I also have a bit of experience with Node, although I feel like I might be a bit rusty on it. Like all I'm very interested in the technology behind digital currencies nowadays, and looking into participating in a cool project.
<@U957TLWTH> has joined the channel
<@U93BJC0F2> has joined the channel

Heyo. Curious about what's going on. I'm a product designer and dev (JS, python, C++, and other experiences). Former IDEO software design team lead and US Digital Service. Did some of the early blockchain research and dev at IDEO back in 2015 (I think), but not been too involved since. Currently standing at attention in honor of my ETH and NEO as they sink into the sea.
<@U93FM2F5W> has joined the channel
Hi guys! i am a solidity/front end/back end developer currently working on Go implementation of sharding for ethereum foundation. Found you guys on reddit and came to check it out
<@U93V9M0JF> has joined the channel
<@U93F5G6DN> has joined the channel
<@U943S9FE0> has joined the channel

Hi! I'm a UI/UX designer and amateur programmer in Java, HTML, XML and Python. I specialize in app/web design and branding (logo and brand Integration). I know Illustrator like the back of my hand, which I primarily use for UI/UX design.
I have worked in a few startups and aim to work on more. Of course I am fascinated by cryptocurrencies, and I hold a few including ETH. I always invest in projects I believe in.

Hi all, I'm a technical entrepreneur, starting a venture to port an existing business to blockchain, to open new services. I'm looking for technologies and people to move this forward. Previous ventures include wireless networking, network security, web commerce, and VR. Conversational in C / C#, can stutter in many others.

Its a great time to be involved in tech and CS! Its hard to not be excited about it every day!  Thanks for putting this all together. I can't wait to see where it takes us! I'll hop onto the <#C9403E24A|group-contracts> channel too

Hi everyone.  I am self taught in a few languages.  Been making HTML CSS PHP JavaScript stuff for close to 10 years and have also made a few projects in Python and C#.  I am holding ETH and currently a miner while that is still necessary.
That’s right!
<@U947AGTT7> has joined the channel
<@U955F5K0F> has joined the channel

Hi everyone, I'm a DevCloudOps guy. I have over 7 years experience working with *nix systems. Over 2 years in DevOps and Cloud practices. I hope to be of use to this exciting endeavour. I can help with any questions or issues regarding support of the systems that will host your apps.

Hello everyone! I'm a self taught programmer with some skills in android, and know a little python, C#, javascript/html/css. Have been looking for an opportunity for a long time to be able to work together in an open source project to build something interesting, so this was perfect for since there's nothing more interesting right now than building a blockchain technology and get to learn by doing.
<@U93DY3872> has joined the channel
<@U943J4AEN> has joined the channel

Great background. I 50% completed this Udemy course

<https://www.udemy.com/deeplearning/learn/v4/>

And as my first introduction to Neural Networks, was blown away by the possibilities.

Glad to have you on board. Would love for you to help out with our group Solidity contracts over in <#C9403E24A|group-contracts>

messages.text:
Awesome! I did a lot of custom analytics collection and data modeling during my Adwords marketing days.

Nice to meet you too!
"involved first of all for philosophical/political reasons and secondary for building some potentially successful products." --- Yes! :slightly_smiling_face:

Hey everyone! I'm a senior Industrial Engineering and Computer Science major at Northwestern University in Chicago, graduating in the spring.  I have done a lot of side projects (mainly data analytics/machine learning) but haven't been a part of a more official group previously.  My strongest languages are python and java script.  Recently I've completed an online course in Solidity and I'm continuing to develop that skill.
<@U940KDSQ3> has joined the channel
<@U94UDS9HU> has joined the channel
<@U93BVG16U> has joined the channel

Hey all, I am a statistician from France. Background in CS with my education, but never really programmed a product professionnaly . Been mostly doing data science for 4-5 years now. I am relatively new to the blockchain space but I have been fascinated by the different projects all around since my intro. Happy to help and to get help as well. Nice to meet you all!

i'm backend developer and been doing some devops, been working professionally with asm/c/c++ but mostly python last years, been moving more towards golang/reactjs recently and have some experience with distributed systems. been working in startups the last couple of years building successful products from scratch. involved first of all for philosophical/political reasons and secondary for building some potentially successful products. nice to meet you all!
<@U93A6AW1E> has joined the channel
hey guys I'm a software engineer and entrepreneur, dabbled in the blockchain space for a bit and excited about brainstorming app / protocol / system ideas and learning more

Glad to have you. Absolutely there are countless helpful use cases, and even those we haven't thought of yet.

I love the concept that value no longer needs to be tied  to corporate profits. In the past, that was the only way we could measure value.

Now, all "value" added to any sub-ecosystem can be rewarded fairly.
<@U9468TZGD> has joined the channel
<@U94S3GNHL> has joined the channel
<@U941V251A> has joined the channel
Looking forward to be involved in Blockchain development. Because i think there is a lot of helpful use case for that tech. Medicine, education, head hunting and more

Hi, im 29 yo web dev from far east of russia, currently living in Saint Petersburg. I started learning web development 7 years from now. Currently working on a gps coordinates movement player for the yauchting sport. You can try and google 3d regatta (making similar app but using openlayers)
Js and php is my buds:)

messages.purpose: Tell the group a little bit about yourself. To add more info, consider editing your original post or adding to its thread.
messages.text: <@U93CZR0LR> set the channel purpose: Tell the group a little bit about yourself. To add more info, consider editing your original post or adding to its thread.
Awesome <@U93V0USBE>! I think there is a world of opportunity opening up for anyone getting involved with blockchain programming.
<@U93DCCQ0Z> has joined the channel

Hi, Im a computer scientist from germany specalized in software technology and language design, i worki for 10 years in a company where I many focus on frontend development, software architecture and implenting it serverside. I hack in alot of programming languages, mostly for my own needs. Sometimes I feel like it might intersset someone else and i cleanup my code and put it on github :wink: i'm very new in the crypto world and try to learn as much as I can (mostly in the monero space). I would like to change my current job into something blockchain related, so I try to educate myself as much as I can in my freetime. Most of the time when I learn something new I just start a project. At the moment it is very hard for a open source developer to just do something blockchain related (because of lack of creativity :D), so i'm looking forward to maybe create something useful :+1:

Hey everyone! A bit about myself:

I've been into programming since ~1999 when I purchased a C++ book as my gateway. Well, that's if you don't count having my dad purchase me "HTML for Dummies, first edition", back in '95 or '96.

Since (before) then I have always had a passion for technology. My programming efforts led me into internet marketing where I used my skills to create tools for internal use, giving me an advantage against competitors (e.g. on Google Adwords). I did a lot of automation, keyword harvesting, and big data analysis / prediction.

The money was in advertising, so that is why I applied my technology skills there. But that was never my passion. Now with Blockchain, I see an opportunity to make a new career, for myself and thousands of others, out of community collaboration.

I have stopped actively focusing on my advertising business (it still runs okay without me) and started focusing full time on Blockchain development. I'm completely obsessed with reading programming books like I used to do when I was a kid.

Playing a bit of catch up on truly mastering the newest of technologies (e.g. Functional Programming), but I have never stopped coding during all these years.

I can't wait to tackle new challenges of learning new languages, frameworks, paradigms, APIs, whatever... and build some awesome stuff in the process with all of you.

Now your turn. Let's hear a little but about you!
<@U93V0USBE> has joined the channel
<@U93CZR0LR> has joined the channel
